Package applicationLayer

Class BlockController

  • java.lang.Object
    • applicationLayer.BlockController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DomainSubject, GUISubject
    public class BlockController
extends java.lang.Object
implements GUISubject, DomainSubject
    The BlockController orchestrates Create, Update, Delete and Retrieve operations for Blocks.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    group17

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      BlockController()
      Construct a BlockController and retrieve an instance of it's BlockRepository.

    • Method Detail

      • addBlock

        public BlockSnapshot addBlock​(BlockType blockType,
                              java.lang.String connectedBlockId,
                              ConnectionType connection)
        Add a block of the given blockType to the domain and connect it with the given connectedBlockId on the given connection
        Parameters:
        blockType - The type of block to be added, this parameter is required.
        connectedBlockId - The ID of the block to connect to, can be empty.
        connection - The connection of the connected block on which the new block must be connected. If no connectedBlockId was given, this parameter must be set to "ConnectionType.NOCONNECTION".
        Returns:
        The id of the block that has been added.
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockConnectionException - The given combination of the blockType,connectedBlockId and connection is impossible. - an ExecutableBlock added to an AssessableBlock or ControlBlock as condition - an AssessableBlock added to a block as a body or "next block" - a block added to another block of which the required connection is not provided. - a block added to a connection of a connected block to which there is already a block connected.
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a connectedBlockId is given that is not present in the domain.
        MaxNbOfBlocksReachedException - The maximum number of blocks in the domain is reached, no extra blocks can be added.
        Events:
        AddBlockEvent - Fires an AddBlockEvent if the execution was successful.
        UpdateGameStateEvent - Fires an UpdateGameStateEvent if the execution was successful.
        ResetExecutionEvent - Fires a ResetExecutionEvent if the execution was successful.
        PanelChangeEvent - Fires a PanelChangeEvent if the maximum number of block has been reached after adding a block.

      • getMaxNbOfBlocks

        public int getMaxNbOfBlocks()
        Retrieve the maximum number of blocks in the domain.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of blocks.

      • removeBlock

        public BlockSnapshot removeBlock​(java.lang.String blockID,
                                 java.lang.Boolean isChain)
        Removes a block with the given blockID from the domain.
        Parameters:
        blockID - The blockID of the block to be removed.
        isChain - A flag announcing if a chain of blocks has to be removed or if only the given blockId has to be removed.
        Returns:
        a snapshot containing all the information regarding the removed block.
        Throws:
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - If the given BlockID doesn't result in a block in the domain.
        Events:
        RemoveBlockEvent - Fires an RemoveBlockEvent if the execution was successful.
        UpdateGameStateEvent - Fires an UpdateGameStateEvent if the execution was successful.
        ResetExecutionEvent - Fires a ResetExecutionEvent if the execution was successful.
        PanelChangeEvent - Fires a PanelChangeEvent if the maximum number of block was reached before removing the block.

      • restoreBlockSnapshot

        public void restoreBlockSnapshot​(BlockSnapshot snapshot,
                                 boolean isChain)
        Restore a given BlockSnapshot and send the needed events according to the type of restore.
        Parameters:
        snapshot - the snapshot to restore
        isChain - a flag indicating if a chain of blocks need to be restored

      • moveBlock

        public BlockSnapshot moveBlock​(java.lang.String topOfMovedChainBlockId,
                               java.lang.String movedBlockId,
                               java.lang.String connectedAfterMoveBlockId,
                               ConnectionType connectionAfterMove)
        Add a block of the given blockType to the domain and connect it with the given connectedBlockId on the given connection
        Parameters:
        topOfMovedChainBlockId - The Id of block to be moved, if you move a chain of blocks this will be the first block in the chain, this parameter is required.
        movedBlockId - The Id of block that's actually being moved, this might be the same as the topOfMovedChainBlockId, if the movedBlockId is empty the topOfMovedChainBlockId will be used in any way.
        connectionAfterMove - The connection of the connected block on which the new block must be connected. If no connectedBlockId was given, this parameter must be set to "ConnectionType.NOCONNECTION".
        connectedAfterMoveBlockId - The ID of the block to connect to, can be empty.
        Returns:
        the blockSnapshot representing the state and state changes affected by this move.
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockConnectionException - The given combination of the blockType,connectedBlockId and connection is impossible. - an ExecutableBlock added to an AssessableBlock or ControlBlock as condition - an AssessableBlock added to a block as a body or "next block" - a block added to another block of which the required connection is not provided. - a block added to a connection of a connected block to which there is already a block connected.
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a connectedBlockId is given that is not present in the domain.
        Events:
        changeBlockEvent - Fires an changeBlockEvent if the execution was successful.
        UpdateGameStateEvent - Fires an UpdateGameStateEvent if the execution was successful.
        ResetExecutionEvent - Fires a ResetExecutionEvent if the execution was successful.

      • getAllBlockIDsUnderneath

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllBlockIDsUnderneath​(java.lang.String blockID)
        Returns all the BlockID's underneath a certain block
        Parameters:
        blockID - The blockID of the Block of which you want to retrieve all Blocks underneath.
        Returns:
        A set containing the blockID's of all connected Conditions and every kind of block in the body of the given block or under the given block. The ID of the block itself is also given.
        Throws:
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a blockID is given that is not present in the domain.

      • getAllBlockIDsInBody

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllBlockIDsInBody​(java.lang.String blockID)
        Returns all the blockID's in the body of a given ControlBlock
        Parameters:
        blockID - The blockID of the controlBlock of which you want to retrieve all Blocks in the body.
        Returns:
        A set containing the blockID of the blocks in the body of the given ControlBlock.
        Throws:
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a blockID is given that is not present in the domain.
        InvalidBlockTypeException - Is thrown when given blockID isn't the ID of a ControlBlock.

      • getBlockType

        public BlockType getBlockType​(java.lang.String id)
        Retrieve the blockType of the block associated with the given id;
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the block to retrieve the Blocktype from.
        Returns:
        the blockType associated with the given block
        Throws:
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a blockID is given that is not present in the domain.

      • checkIfConnectionIsOpen

        public java.lang.Boolean checkIfConnectionIsOpen​(java.lang.String blockIdToCheck,
                                                 ConnectionType connection,
                                                 java.util.Set<java.lang.String> changingBlocks)
        Check if the connection is open and can be used to perform a move or add on.
        Parameters:
        blockIdToCheck - The id of the block to check the connection from
        connection - The connection to check on the given block
        changingBlocks - A set with the id's of all blocks that are changing at the moment as to keep in measure that if the blockToCheck is connected to one of the blocks in this set that connection will be removed after the operation and hence can be ignored. If this parameter is null an empty set will be used and the method won't keep in mind any possible changed blocks.
        Returns:
        A flag indicating if the given connection for the given block is open.
        Throws:
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a blockID is given that is not present in the domain.
